0:
Two runaway boys slipped to the back of an upmarket strip mall. They hurried toward the closest dumpster.

"See? It wasn't so difficult to get away from that foster family," Steve said.

Mike lifted the dumpster lid. "They'll report us to Child Protective Services though, and then we'll have to worry about cops," he sighed. "And there's nothing to eat in this dumpster."

Steve removed a cardboard box. There wasn't food inside it, just a shabby jacket.

"This might work as a pillow, right?" He said, lifting it.

Mike rolled his eyes, digging deeper into the dumpster. Steve saw something inside the jacket's pocket.

"Mike! Our mom...she had the same one," Steve grabbed his brother's shoulder and showed what was in his hand.

"Do you even remember our mom passed away?" Mike asked. But then he turned pale, seeing what his twin brother held in his hand.

The full story is in the comments.

I've been on maternity leave for years, taking care of our three kids in a row.

I can’t even begin to tell you HOW BADLY I want to work! I've been working part-time from home whenever I could, and for years, I've saved money for my education. I wanted to change careers and work full-time as the kids grew up and went to school.

My plan was perfect until I accidentally overheard my husband Jack'S conversation with his friend, Adam:

Adam: "Man, your wife is so cool! My Linda told me Emma was going to study again. That’s WOW!"

MY FIERCE STEPMOM KICKED ME OUT OF HOME AND DAD DIDN’T PROTECT ME – ONE CALL MADE HER REGRET IT FOREVER.

I came home after work. Suddenly, my crazy stepmother Karen and my dad stopped me.

Dad: I don’t know how to say this... but...
Her: YOU NEED TO MOVE OUT!
Me: WHAT?! Dad, what is she talking about?!
Her: My baby is on the way. You’ll just be a burden. We need space for the child!
Me: But...Where will I go? I can’t afford rent...I work part-time, and study! And... God, this is my home too! Dad, say something! Please!

I couldn't believe it! Was I being thrown out of my own home?! Dad looked at me, then back at Karen, but stayed silent. I was so done.

Me: You know what? You two can go to hell!

I stormed off to my room, slamming the door. I had nothing to do. Only one thing could help me...

So I dialed the number.

MY MIL LET HER FRIEND USE MY CLOTHES AND MAKEUP WHILE I WAS ON A BUSINESS TRIP — KARMA WORKED ON THEM BETTER THAN ANY REVENGE.

So, I had to go on a business trip to New York for a week. I left Dave and our daughter at home, thinking everything would be fine since my MIL, Janet, offered to help out. She moved in for the week to take care of things, and I thought that was a relief. Boy, was I wrong...

Two days in, Lisa — my neighbor and best friend — calls me, all frantic. She asks if I know someone named Sheryl. I'm like, "No, why?" And then she drops this bombshell: Sheryl, Janet's friend, has been parading around my house in my clothes and using my makeup! I was in shock. Who does that?

Lisa even sent me a video she had taken through her window. There was Sheryl, in my favorite red dress, putting on my Chanel lipstick like she owned the place! I was FURIOUS but had to keep it together because I still had three days of meetings ahead.

When I finally got home, my closet was a disaster. Clothes thrown everywhere, makeup ruined, and the worst part? My wedding dress was on the floor with a huge red wine stain. I confronted Janet, and she told me Sheryl had a date and just wanted to look nice. She figured it was harmless since Sheryl was only borrowing my things. And Sheryl? She "apologized" with a smirk on her face, like it was no big deal!

I was LIVID but decided to let karma take care of it. And karma didn't waste any time... First, Sheryl got into ⬇️

I WAS READING MY GRANDKIDS A BOOK ABOUT A SECRET CHAMBER WHEN SUDDENLY, THEY REVEALED THAT THEIR PARENTS HAD ONE TOO.

I'm 64 and recently widowed. My son and daughter-in-law have supported me a lot, and they invited me to live at their home for some time.

I agreed as it was hard to stay totally alone. The only thing they asked of me was NOT to go to the basement, as there were repairs being done. It was very dusty, and I’m allergic to dust.

So, here I am, babysitting my grandkids, cooking meals, and trying to be grateful to my kids.

Moving forward to yesterday. It was almost 9 p.m., and I was reading "Harry Potter and the Chamber of Secrets" to the kids. Suddenly, Eric, 4, exclaimed:

Eric: We have the Chamber of Secrets too! In the basement!
John: Eric, hush!! Grandma, he's kidding.
Eric: I'm not. I'll show it to you.

Three mischievous grandmas were sitting on a bench outside a nursing home. An old man walked by, and one of the grandmas yelled out, “We bet we can tell exactly how old you are.”

The old man said, “There ain’t no way you can guess it, you old fools.”

One of the grandmas said, “Sure we can! Just drop your pants and we can tell your exact age.”

Embarrassed just a little, the old man dropped his pants.

The grandmas stared at him for a while, asked him to turn around a couple of times, asked him to jump up and down for a little while and then they all piped up and said, “YOU'RE 91 YEARS OLD!”

“How in the world did you guess?” the old man said in shock.
The grandmas snickered and laughed.

Slapping their knees and grinning from ear to ear, all three happily yelled in unison, “Because⬇️
15:
"UHG! YOU CAN’T BE SERIOUS!" Louis grumbled as he noticed a mom-of-3 nearby.

"Sir," the stewardess said. "These seats have been assigned to this lady and her kids."

Louis got even more annoyed as he was forced to sit next to a woman who wore the cheapest clothes on the flight. When she asked him about his work, he started laughing:

"A poor woman like you would never understand it! I saw your tickets and everything. You don't look like someone who deserves to be here!"

He was going to say more, but suddenly, the captain's voice stopped him.

The full story is in the comments.

EXHAUSTED, I WOKE UP TO FIND MY TWINS’ LUNCHBOXES ALREADY PACKED AND THE KITCHEN CLEANED.

As a single mom of energetic twin boys, I've been feelin' totally overwhelmed and exhausted lately. Balancin' work, takin' care of my sons, and keepin' up with chores leaves me with barely any energy by day's end.

One particularly stressful night, I stayed up late cleanin' the kitchen and gettin' the twins' lunchboxes ready for school. I set my alarm early, hopin' to get a head start.

When the alarm went off, I dragged myself out of bed, dreadin' the tasks ahead. But as I walked into the kitchen, I was floored. The kitchen was spotless, gleamin' from a thorough cleanin'. On the counter were two perfectly packed lunchboxes with healthy snacks and little notes for my boys.

I was stunned and couldn't figure out who had done this. I checked the house for any signs of an intruder but found nothin' unusual. I even called my close relatives, but none of them had been over.

With tears of relief, I realized someone had helped me. But I also felt anxious not knowin' who it was.
